Understanding Gynecomastia

Gynecomastia, often colloquially referred to as male breast enlargement, is a condition that can affect individuals of all ages. While it might not be widely discussed, it’s more common than you might think. This condition results from an imbalance in hormones, specifically an increase in estrogen levels or a decrease in testosterone. It can also be triggered by factors such as genetics, obesity, certain medications, or even underlying medical conditions. At my clinic in Jaipur, I have encountered a range of cases, from mild to severe, and I am dedicated to addressing each patient’s unique needs.

Understanding the impact of gynecomastia goes beyond the physical aspect. Many individuals who experience this condition often struggle with self-esteem and body image issues. They might avoid certain clothing styles or situations due to embarrassment or discomfort. This assessment guides the choice of treatment, which could involve surgical excision of the glandular tissue, liposuction, or a combination of both.
